@hachikuji yes, you are right. As per your comments, I removed some unnecessary code for resource cleanup. ZkUtils.maybeDelete was also refined to capture the ZkException when the to-be-delete path is not empty. The fix only applies for the ConsoleConsumer shutdown via sending SIGINT and SIGTERM. For "kill -9", seems we cannot guarantee it works since application cannot capture it. Do all these make senses?
Thanks for the review @junrao. I add test code to verify the end mark.

If a leader changes due to the leader failure, ISR will change. However, if a leader changes due to leader balancing, ISR may not change. So, I am not sure if it's accurate to always mark the isrShrinkRate on leader change. Perhaps we can just add a comment that "isrShrinkRate is only captured when the leader (not the controller) shrinks the ISR".

Hi @guozhangwang, hope you're fine.

I've did the requested updates, although now I'm a bit ashamed to push such a trivial change :)
As a bonus, I've did minor clean-up in interface and added the javadoc, describing approach, which saved me eventually and was not clear for me without external help.

I see some test failures, but I'd rather blame race conditions in tests... What do you think?

P.S.: I've also kept the original "major" approach, but moved it to another branch, just for history:
https://github.com/stepio/kafka/tree/feature/KAFKA-3923

Refer to this link for build results (access rights to CI server needed):

LGTM, and tests are now passing: https://jenkins.confluent.io/job/system-test-kafka-branch-builder-2/170/console

Thanks @shikhar!
